title: Four arrested after ‘kidnap victim’ is seen being forced into BMW
text:
A witness told police they saw a man being bundled into a black BMW in Peckham (Picture: Google)

Police are appealing for information after witnesses reported seeing a man being forced into a BMW in south London.

The Met said the ‘kidnap’ happened at around 2.25pm on Sunday, 6 October, in Kinsale Road, near to the junction of Dewar Street, in Peckham.

Officers were able to track the car down and arrested four men on suspicion of kidnap.

All four remain in custody but work is continuing to identify the victim, police said.

In a statement, the Met said: ‘A witness reported seeing a male being forced into the black car by three other males.

‘The car then drove off in the direction of Dewar Street before turning into Fenwick Road and Amott Road.

‘Fast-time investigative work led to police recovering the vehicle, registration YE19 NDX, and four men, no further details, have been arrested on suspicion of kidnap.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Anyone with information is asked to contact Central South CID on 101 and quote reference 4379/6Oct.

Alternatively, call Crimestoppers anonymously on 0800 555 111.
